ygData.subject: Re: Twinking & Kiting
ygData.msgSnippet: Well you heard wrong because it is known that when you fight something that is 5+ lvls higher than you exp sucks this is to keep such a thing from happening
ygData.messageBody:
Well you heard wrong because it is known that when you fight
something that is 5+ lvls higher than you exp sucks this is to keep such a
thing from happening the DEV team did this because stuff at that lvl are not
meant for players at that low of a lvl to fight believe me and a friend
where with a group (not grouped but they hgealed us buffed...etc) fighting
SandGiants and the exp was awful I got better exp fighting hihgh greens.
-----Original Message-----
From: KAUFFMAN,ROBERT (HP-FtCollins,ex1) <robert_kauffman@...>
To: 'EQ-Clerics@onelist.com' <EQ-Clerics@onelist.com>
Date: Monday, July 12, 1999 12:59 PM
Subject: RE: [EQ-Clerics] Twinking & Kiting


>From: "KAUFFMAN,ROBERT (HP-FtCollins,ex1)" <robert_kauffman@...>
>
>That is not necessarily true. I'm a level 4 cleric with full banded and 2
>combine weapons plus jewelry. When I started this character I played till
I
>had gotten about 4 plat then I started brewing. Once I became a master
>brewer I started pottery. With pottery you can make 30-40 plat an hour. I
>have not been twinked but I would fit your description. Another twinking
>method is for a high level cleric to buff a low level character and then
>stun a mid level creature as the low level character kills him. I have
>heard of a guild that can have a new character to level 20 in 5 hours with
>this method.
>
>Fidan
>
>-----Original Message-----
>From: LordRhaa@... [mailto:LordRhaa@...]
>Sent: Monday, July 12, 1999 10:50 AM
>To: EQ-Clerics@onelist.com
>Subject: Re: [EQ-Clerics] Twinking & Kiting
>
>
>From: LordRhaa@...
>
> I have heard several descriptions for it but the most common is when
>
>you give your low lvl Char equip or money from your higher lvl char. Like
a
>
>lvl 2 Cleric with full chainmail you know has been twinked.
>
> Kiting is when that Druid (or other caster with a DOT spell) casts
>it
>on a monster and then runs, casts, runs,ect .. till the monster is dead.
>
